sections.heading: Short title.
sections.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Educational Trustees Act.

sections.heading: The number of trustees of any college, seminary or academy,
sections.text:
incorporated under any general or special law of this state, and possessing
no capital stock, may be increased in the manner hereinafter provided.

sections.heading: The board of trustees of any such college, seminary or academy may,
sections.text:
at any regular annual meeting thereof adopt a resolution declaring the
number of members of which its board of trustees shall thereafter consist,
and specifying the number to be added to the membership of such board as
stated in the act incorporating such college, seminary or academy or in its
charter.

sections.heading: Whenever any such resolution shall have been adopted by such board
sections.text:
of trustees, a certified copy thereof, verified by the affidavit of the
president of the board and under the corporate seal of such college,
seminary or academy, shall be filed in the office of the Secretary of
State, and a like copy filed in the office of the recorder of the
county where such college, seminary or academy is located upon the filing
of such certified copies, the number of trustees specified in the
resolution so adopted shall be and become the legal number of trustees of
such college, seminary or academy.

sections.heading: The power to increase the number of trustees of any such college,
sections.text:
seminary or academy shall not be exhausted by the increase of the number of
its trustees to any number less than twenty-five, but such power may be
exercised at different annual meetings of its board of trustees until said
number is reached.
